column5: mornin all  will be my first time fishing there and wondering how the boat launch is at island lake my 4x4 is not working on my truck at the moment and i dont want to get stuck launching is 4x4 required or would i be fine

Island Lake Conservation Area Telephone: (519) 941-6329, 1-800-367-0890 Email: [emailÂ protected] Location: 673067 Hurontario Street, Orangeville, (G6/C9 on map) Website: http://www.creditvalleycons.com/recandleisure/islandlake.htm

Should be okay with a 16'er.  I've launched 20' bassboats there and don't recall needing 4wd to get out.  You do have to back in a little deeper than usual since you can't powerload and dry winching a 3500 lb boat is tough!  Charles
Thanks Oh you mean Charles. Sorry.
You should have no problem launching a 16'er at their ramp. It is a "No Gas Motors" lake, but you probably already knew that
thanks for the heads up jedi. i had no idea as ive seen lots of bass boats in there while driving by so i assumed gas motors were allowed. i guess orangeville is out, what about belwood???
I have no info on the lake but just wanted to second on the cool avitar.  Best I've seen yet. It's hillarious
